trans-unit.source: Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure

trans-unit.source: How to Fix Error ACS50017
trans-unit.target: How to Fix Error ACS50017

trans-unit.source: This topic provides information about possible causes of and solutions for the ACS50017 error.
trans-unit.target: This topic provides information about possible causes of and solutions for the ACS50017 error.

trans-unit.source: Likely Causes of ACS50017
trans-unit.target: Likely Causes of ACS50017

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> returns ACS50017 when it cannot build a certificate chain for a signing certificate of a trusted identity provider, such as a trusted ADFS server.
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> returns ACS50017 when it cannot build a certificate chain for a signing certificate of a trusted identity provider, such as a trusted ADFS server.

trans-unit.source: This error occurs under the following conditions.
trans-unit.target: This error occurs under the following conditions.

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> cannot validate the certificate used to generate the digital signature of a token from the identity provider.
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> cannot validate the certificate used to generate the digital signature of a token from the identity provider.

trans-unit.source: A commercial certificate in the certificate chain does not have the "Access Method=Certification Authority Issuer" extension, which includes a link to the immediate parent certificate.
trans-unit.target: A commercial certificate in the certificate chain does not have the "Access Method=Certification Authority Issuer" extension, which includes a link to the immediate parent certificate.

trans-unit.source: For more information about <token>secondref_acs</token> error codes, see <link xlink:href="5ba09d76-7619-40e4-aa8d-ce3d5f3e77f8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS Error Codes</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about <token>secondref_acs</token> error codes, see <link xlink:href="5ba09d76-7619-40e4-aa8d-ce3d5f3e77f8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS Error Codes</link>.

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> cannot retrieve the intermediate certificates from the root certification authority to verify the trust chain.
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> cannot retrieve the intermediate certificates from the root certification authority to verify the trust chain.

trans-unit.source: The ACS50017 typically appears as part of a comprehensive error message that is likely to include the ACS50008 error message.
trans-unit.target: The ACS50017 typically appears as part of a comprehensive error message that is likely to include the ACS50008 error message.

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> requires that commercial certificates acquired from a trusted certification authority include an "Authority Info Access" with "Access Method=Certification Authority Issuer" extension.
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> requires that commercial certificates acquired from a trusted certification authority include an "Authority Info Access" with "Access Method=Certification Authority Issuer" extension.

trans-unit.source: The extension value must include a URL that links to a publicly available downloadable copy of its parent certificate (.crt).
trans-unit.target: The extension value must include a URL that links to a publicly available downloadable copy of its parent certificate (.crt).

trans-unit.source: This requirement applies to every certificate in the certificate chain, except for the root certificate and its immediate child certificate.
trans-unit.target: This requirement applies to every certificate in the certificate chain, except for the root certificate and its immediate child certificate.

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> returns the ACS50017 error if these conditions are not met.
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> returns the ACS50017 error if these conditions are not met.

trans-unit.source: This code shows the format of the Certification Authority Issuer extension for a fictitious certificate.
trans-unit.target: This code shows the format of the Certification Authority Issuer extension for a fictitious certificate.

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> downloads and caches certificates in an intermediate certificate store on the <token>secondref_acs</token> virtual machines (VM).
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> downloads and caches certificates in an intermediate certificate store on the <token>secondref_acs</token> virtual machines (VM).

trans-unit.source: The intermediate certificate remains available on the VM until the VM is recycled.
trans-unit.target: The intermediate certificate remains available on the VM until the VM is recycled.

trans-unit.source: The cache improves performance and allows <token>secondref_acs</token> to access the intermediate certificate even when network issues prevent it from contacting the root certification authority.
trans-unit.target: The cache improves performance and allows <token>secondref_acs</token> to access the intermediate certificate even when network issues prevent it from contacting the root certification authority.

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> returns the ACS50017 error when an entry for the certificate is not found in the intermediate certificate store (cache) on the VM and a network call to the root certification authority fails.
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> returns the ACS50017 error when an entry for the certificate is not found in the intermediate certificate store (cache) on the VM and a network call to the root certification authority fails.

trans-unit.source: The ACS50017 error can occur intermittently if the Windows Aure load-balancer directs an <token>secondref_acs</token> client to an <token>secondref_acs</token> VM that has not yet cached the certificate for the identity provider.
trans-unit.target: The ACS50017 error can occur intermittently if the Windows Aure load-balancer directs an <token>secondref_acs</token> client to an <token>secondref_acs</token> VM that has not yet cached the certificate for the identity provider.

trans-unit.source: Potential Solutions for ACS50017
trans-unit.target: Potential Solutions for ACS50017

trans-unit.source: Use any of the following methods to resolve the problem and prevent a recurrence of the error.
trans-unit.target: Use any of the following methods to resolve the problem and prevent a recurrence of the error.

trans-unit.source: If there is a problem with a commercial certificate in the certificate chain, you can substitute a self-signed certificate for the commercial certificate.
trans-unit.target: If there is a problem with a commercial certificate in the certificate chain, you can substitute a self-signed certificate for the commercial certificate.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="b75ed5c7-ca81-44a2-8d8d-6a63399f87dd" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Certificates and Keys</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="b75ed5c7-ca81-44a2-8d8d-6a63399f87dd" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Certificates and Keys</link>.

trans-unit.source: If a certificate in the certificate chain does not include the required "Access Method=Certification Authority Issuer" extension, or the extension does not includes a URL, or the URL does not link to a publicly available copy of the parent certificate, you need to replace the certificate.
trans-unit.target: If a certificate in the certificate chain does not include the required "Access Method=Certification Authority Issuer" extension, or the extension does not includes a URL, or the URL does not link to a publicly available copy of the parent certificate, you need to replace the certificate.

trans-unit.source: If the certificate has all of the required elements, but <token>secondref_acs</token> cannot acquire it after three attempts, the operation might be timing out due to temporary network conditions or a problem at the certification authority server.
trans-unit.target: If the certificate has all of the required elements, but <token>secondref_acs</token> cannot acquire it after three attempts, the operation might be timing out due to temporary network conditions or a problem at the certification authority server.

trans-unit.source: The certificate provider might be able to improve the performance of certificate acquisition.
trans-unit.target: The certificate provider might be able to improve the performance of certificate acquisition.

trans-unit.source: Retry the request.
trans-unit.target: Retry the request.

trans-unit.source: If the load balancer directs the request to a VM that has the cached certificate or a connectivity issue that prevented access to the certification authority is resolved, requests that previously failed will succeed.
trans-unit.target: If the load balancer directs the request to a VM that has the cached certificate or a connectivity issue that prevented access to the certification authority is resolved, requests that previously failed will succeed.

trans-unit.source: Certificate Chaining Engine (CCE)
trans-unit.target: Certificate Chaining Engine (CCE)
